page.title: 11Finningley village - history
page.content: {Finningley}village was mentioned in the Domesday Book,as {'Feniglei' } which means 'clearing of fen dwellers'.It is about 5 miles away from Bawtry.The land around it is only 7 metres above sea level. The {church}is about 900 years old, and gets its name from {St.Oswald}who was king of Northumbria at that time. It is built of limestone.The Norman door has elaborate,trefoil carvings and is very strong.The roof of the nave is solidly built of oak timbers,with delicate carvings in some parts.There are two monuments:the first to Rev.Edmond Harvey,Rector,and the second to Rev.John Harvey,also a Rector.The Harvey family was important in the history of the village as they were principal landowners.
